For example, a comprehensive analysis by the World Health Organization found that coal power results in around 100 deaths per terawatt-hour of energy produced. In contrast, nuclear power causes an estimated 1,800 deaths per terawatt-hour.

So in summary, when we objectively analyze the mortality rates per unit of energy produced, coal emerges as the clear winner in terms of safety compared to nuclear power.
